title: Create a welcome message within an ad account

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: auto_message_type
parameters.description: The type of automatic message to greet people with when they start a conversation with you. Enum value: WELCOME_MESSAGE : welcome message. A welcome message is a message that is automatically sent to welcome people to the conversation after they tap on your ad.

parameters.name: welcome_message Conditional
parameters.description: Required when auto_message_type is WELCOME_MESSAGE . Information about the welcome message.

parameters.name: title Conditional
parameters.description: Required when welcome_message is passed. The name of the welcome message. You can specify a unique name to distinguish between different welcome messages within the welcome message library of your ad account.

parameters.name: content Conditional
parameters.description: Required when welcome_message is passed. The greeting within the welcome message. Length limit: 200 characters. Example: Hi, thanks for contacting us. How can we help you?

parameters.name: suggested_questions Conditional
parameters.description: Required when welcome_message is passed. A list of suggested questions for customers to tap. A suggested question is a frequently asked question displayed at the beginning of a chat. When the user selects a suggested question, the user will automatically receive the corresponding preset answer. Size range: 1-3.

parameters.name: question Conditional
parameters.description: Required when welcome_message is passed. A frequently asked question to help users start a conversation. Length limit: 70 characters.

parameters.name: answer Conditional
parameters.description: Required when welcome_message is passed. The preset answer that will be automatically sent when a user selects the question. Length limit: 500 characters.
